intro: Pachypleurum albomarginatum, commonly known as the white-margin pachypleurum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy white flowers with distinctive yellow markings. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal dunes. Its foliage is broad and leathery, with a prominent white margin that distinguishes it from other species in the genus.
